page.title: 03LLANRHIDIAN VILLAGE
page.content: LLANRHIDIAN WAS ONCE A CENTRE OF FAMILY WEAVING AND SHEEP REARING. THERE ARE REMAINS OF SEVERAL MILLS AND NETHER MILL ALTHOUGH NOT WORKING IS IN GOOD CONDITION.NEAR THIS MILL ARE THE BUILDINGS OF THE FORMER WOOLLEN FACTORY AT STAVEL HAGER WHOSE LOOMS WERE DISMANTLED IN 1904. THE CHURCH OF ST.ILLTYD AND ST.RHIDIAN IS SITUATED BENEATH A LIMESTONE BLUFF. IT HAS A LARGE WEST TOWER AND LIKE MOST GOWER CHURCHES IS OF 13th CENTURY OROGIN. A STANDING STONE OF CONGLOMERATE(PROBABLY FROM CEFN BRYN) IS MOUNTED ON A LIMESTONE BASE ON THE VILLAGE GREEN.IT IS SAID TO BE THE REMAINS OF A VILLAGE CROSS.IT MAY ALSO HAVE BEEN USED AS A PILLORY BEFORE THE 19th CENTURY.IT WAS RE-ERECTED IN 1821 AND THE OTHER LARGE LIMESTONE IN 1844.
